content.text: Find \(\mathrm{n}(A \cap B)\)
Find \(\mathrm{n}(A \cup B)\)
It is given that \(\mathcal{E} = \{x: 0 < x < 35, x \in \mathbb{R}\}\) and sets \(A\) and \(B\) are such that
It is given that sets \(X, Y\) and \(Z\) are such that

content.blockMath: \[X\cap Y = Y,\quad X\cap Z = Z\quad \mathrm{and}~Y\cap Z = \emptyset .\]

content.text: On the Venn diagram below, illustrate sets \(X, Y\) and \(Z\)
On the axes below sketch, for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\), the graph of \(y = 1 + 3 \cos 2x\)
Write down the coordinates of the point where this graph first has a minimum value
The first three terms in the expansion of \(\left(a + \frac{x^{5}}{4}\right)^{5}\) are \(32 + bx + cx^{2}\). Find the value of each of the constants \(a\), \(b\) and \(c\)
Find \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\)
Using your answer to part (i), find the matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}\mathbf{M} = \begin{pmatrix} - 1 & - 5 \\ 4 & 2 \end{pmatrix}\)
It is given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & - 3 \\ 2 & 4 \end{pmatrix}\)
\(\mathbf{X}\) is \(\begin{pmatrix} a & - 1 \\ 2 & - 3 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{Y}\) is \(\begin{pmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ 4 & 3a \end{pmatrix}\), where \(a\) is a constant
Given that \(\operatorname *{det}\mathbf{X} = 4 \operatorname *{det}\mathbf{Y},\) find the value of \(a\)
Show that \(\cos \mathrm{e} \theta - \sin \theta = \cot \theta \cos \theta .\)
Hence solve the equation \(\cos \mathrm{e} \theta - \sin \theta = \frac{1}{3} \cos \theta , \quad \text{for} \ 0 \leqslant \theta \leqslant 2 \pi\) radians
there are no restrictions,
the arrangement must start with the letter T and end with the letter Y,
the second letter in the arrangement must be Y
The letters of the word THURSDAY are arranged in a straight line. Find the number of different arrangements of these letters if
there are no restrictions,
all the boys are in one group,
one boy and one girl are twins and must be in the same group
7 children have to be divided into two groups, one of 4 children and the other of 3 children. Given that there are 3 girls and 4 boys, find the number of different ways this can be done if

A vector \(\mathbf{v}\) has a magnitude of 102 units and has the same direction as \(\begin{pmatrix} 8 \\ - 15 \end{pmatrix}\). Find \(\mathbf{v}\) in the form \(\begin{pmatrix} a \\ b \end{pmatrix}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers

Vectors \(\mathbf{c} = \begin{pmatrix} 4 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{d} = \begin{pmatrix} p - q \\ 5p + q \end{pmatrix}\) are such that \(\mathbf{c} + 2\mathbf{d} = \begin{pmatrix} p^2 \\ 27 \end{pmatrix}\). Find the possible values of the constants \(p\) and \(q\)
Find an expression for the gradient of the curve at the point \((x, y)\)
The curve passes through the point \(P\big(\frac{\pi}{12}, -\frac{1}{2}\big)\)
Find the equation of the curve
Find the equation of the normal to the curve at the point \(P\), giving your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\), where \(m\) and \(c\) are constants correct to 3 decimal places
A curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{d}x^{2}} = 4 \sin 2x\). The curve has a gradient of 5 at the point where \(x = \frac{\pi}{2}\)
Find the value of \(\theta\) in terms of \(\pi\)
Find the perimeter of the shaded region
Find the area of the shaded region

The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\), radius \(10\mathrm{cm}\). Points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) lie on the circumference of the circle such that \(AC = BC\) . The area of the minor sector \(AOB\) is \(20\pi \mathrm{cm}^2\) and angle \(AOB\) is \(\theta\) radians

The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = (2x - 5)^{\frac{3}{2}}\) and the line \(y = 3\sqrt{3}\). The curve meets the \(x\)-axis at the point \(A\) and the line \(y = 3\sqrt{3}\) at the point \(B\). Find the area of the shaded region enclosed
by the line \(AB\) and the curve, giving your answer in the form \(\frac{p\sqrt{3}}{20}\), where \(p\) is an integer. You must show all your working.
Find the value of \(A\) and of \(b\)
Find the value of \(y\) when \(x = 2\)

It is given that \(y = A\mathrm{e}^{bx}\), where \(A\) and \(b\) are constants. When \(\ln y\) is plotted against \(x\) a straight line graph is obtained which passes through the points (1.0, 0.7) and (2.5, 3.7)
